hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Uthman al-Khurasani and Ahmad ibn al-Nadhr from Abdullah ibn Ubayd from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ sent me to Yemen, so I said: O Messenger of Allah, you are sending me while I am a young man with no knowledge of judgment. He said: So he placed his hand on my chest and invoked for me, saying: O Allah, guide his heart and affirm his tongue and teach him right judgment and establish him with a firm statement. Then he said: O Ali, when two disputants sit before you, do not hasten in judgment between them until you hear what the other says. O Ali, do not judge between two while you are angry, and do not accept a gift from a disputant, and do not host him without his opponent, for verily Allah the Mighty and Majestic will guide your heart and affirm your tongue. He said: So he said, may Allah be pleased with him: By the One who split the grain and created the soul, I never doubted in judgment after that.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Ubayd al-Laithi through his father and grandfather from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: Evidence is more deserving than a false oath. I asked Zayd ibn Ali, may Allah be pleased with both, about the explanation of this, he said: It is when a man swears regarding another man's right, then evidence stands for the owner of the right regarding his right, so the imam should judge for him with that.
